When Kathie Lee Gifford honored her “Today” co-host and close friend Hoda Kotb at the American Cancer Society’s Mother of the Year lunch, a spy said, “It was a real tearjerker . . . Kathie talked about Hoda’s infectious spirit and their deep friendship. Hoda shared her emotional journey that led her to adopting her daughter, Haley [Joy]. It brought the entire crowd to tears.”

Megyn Kelly, Sheinelle Jones, Dylan Dreyer and Al Roker were all cheering Kotb on.

Gifford had just learned her tune “He Saw Jesus,” which she wrote for late husband Frank Gifford, reach No. 1 on the Christian iTunes chart. Proceeds go to Samaritan’s Purse.
